thread.title: CLIPPERS: Manhandle shorthanded Warriors in exhibition, 130-95
thread.title_full: CLIPPERS: Manhandle shorthanded Warriors in exhibition, 130-95 - Press Enterprise

author: DAN WOIKE
title: CLIPPERS: Manhandle shorthanded Warriors in exhibition, 130-95
text:
By DAN WOIKE / STAFF WRITER
Published: Oct. 20, 2015 Updated: 11:08 p.m. Technically, it's a win.
The Clippers defeated the NBA's reigning champs 130-95 in a preseason game that featured plenty of complaining.
The teams combined for eight technical fouls (and 66 personal fouls) in a marathon preseason game that lasted nearly three hours.
Chris Paul received two of those technicals in a quick span during the third quarter, getting ejected.
Still, with the Warriors missing some starters, including reigning league MVP Stephen Curry, and the Clippers hitting on all cylindars, it didn't matter much.
Blake Griffin led six players in double figures with 29 points, and Austin Rivers added 16 off the bench.
